intro: Polium diffusum, commonly known as field panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. The plant has slender,丛生 stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a rough texture. It is often considered a weed but can serve as a food source for certain insects and livestock.
